title: LIVE MUSIC: Saturday Oct. 3 - Entertainment & Life
text: POP Greg Abate and the Tim Ray Trio featuring John Lockwood and Mark Walker, jazz, Chan’s Restaurant, 267 Main St., Woonsocket. 765-1900, chanseggrollsandjazz.com . 8, 10 p.m. $30 early show; $25 late show; $35 both shows. CD release party. After Dark, rock, Broadway Lounge, 535 North Broadway, East Providence. 434-9742. 9 p.m. No cover. The Vini Ames Duo, swing, pop, rhythm and blues and oldies, Garden Zen Restaurant and Bar, 495 Washington St., Coventry. 825-6888, gardenzenri.com . 7:30-10:30 p.m. Blurred Vision, rock, Twin River, Lighthouse Bar, 100 Twin River Rd., Lincoln. 723-3200, (877) 827-4837, twinriver.com . 9 p.m.-2 a.m. No cover. 18+. The Liz Boudreau Duo, pop, Twin River, Shipyard Pub, 100 Twin River Rd., Lincoln. 723-3200, (877) 827-4837, twinriver.com . 9 p.m. No cover. 18+.  Brown University Latin Jazz and Pop Festival: Palo and Jesus Andujar and Grupo Sazon, Aurora, 276 Westminster St., Providence. 837-5438. 9 p.m. Steve Burke, jazz, Trattoria Romana, 3 Wake Robin Rd., Lincoln. 333-6700. 5-9 p.m. The Calamari Brothers, swing, Elks Lodge #2359, 326 Farnum Pike (Route 104), Smithfield. 231-9820. 7:30-11 p.m. $5. Benefit for Elks charities. Roger Ceresi's All Starz, rhythm and blues and swing, Rhode Island State House, 82 Smith St., Providence. 3:30-5:45 p.m. Free. Gloria Gemma Foundation Flames of Hope: Celebration of Life. Mike Coletta, acoustic rock, Chelo’s Hometown Bar and Grille, Apple Valley Mall, 445 Putnam Pike (Route 44), Greenville. 233-2340. 8:30 p.m. The Coppola/Turner Overdrive, rock, Music Man Cafe, 1565 Plainfield Pike, Johnston. 270-5336. 8-11 p.m. The Dunn Bros., rock, Oak Hill Tavern, 565 Tower Hill Rd. (Route 1), North Kingstown. 294-3282. 9 p.m. No cover. Deborah Anne Fisher, folk and Americana, and Bonnie Jeanne Delongchamp, Americana, jazz and blues, Wamsutta Club, 427 County St., New Bedford. (508) 997-7431, wepecket.com . 7 p.m. $18; $14 seniors and children. Full Circle, rock, 133 Club, 29 Warren Ave., East Providence. 438-1330, 133club.net . 9 p.m. No cover. Gang of Four and The New Regime, rock, The Met, Hope Artiste Village, 1005 Main St., Pawtucket. 729-1005, themetri.com . 9 p.m. $17 advance; $20 day of show. All ages. Joe Godfrey, jazz, Rhumbline, 62 Bridge St., Newport. 849-3999. 6:30-10 p.m. Page 2 of 3 - The Gothard Sisters, folk, Common Fence Point Community Hall, 933 Anthony Rd., Portsmouth. 683-5085, commonfencemusic.org . 8 p.m. $20 advance; $23 door. Haunt the House, folk and blues. Stone Soup Coffeehouse, Slater Mill, 67 Roosevelt Ave., Pawtucket. 248-4692, stonesoupcoffeehouse.com . 7 p.m. $16. Milt Javery, rhythm and blues and jazz, Portofino Bar and Grille, Ramada Middletown Hotel, 425 East Main St., Middletown. 846-3555. 6-9 p.m. The Bobby Justin Band, pop and oldies, VFW Kelley-Gazzero Post #2812, 1418 Plainfield St., Cranston. 942-9500. 7-11 p.m. Al Keith and Friends, acoustic open mic, Java Madness, 134 Salt Pond Rd., Wakefield. 788-0088. 2-5 p.m. Dick Lupino, Joe Esposito, Nina Ott and Rick Wells, jazz, Greenvale Vineyards, Tasting Room, 582 Wapping Rd., Portsmouth. 847-3777, greenvale.com . 1-4 p.m. Dave Macklin, pop, Camille’s, 71 Bradford St. (off Atwells Avenue), Providence. 751-4812. 9 p.m.- midnight. Magnolia, Cajun, Sandywoods Center for the Arts, 43 Muse Way, Tiverton. 241-7349, sandywoodsmusic.com . 7 p.m. $10 advance; $12 door. Mark Markrush, open mic, Sports Legends Pub, 2121 West Shore Rd., Warwick. 732-3886. 2:30-6 p.m. Jack McNamara, pop, Weekapaug Inn, 25 Spray Rock Rd., Westerly. (888) 813-7862, weekapauginn.com . 6:30-9:30 p.m. The Millrats, rock, Last Resort, 325 Farnum Pike, Smithfield. 349-3500, thelastresortri.com . 9:30 p.m. The Alger Mitchell Group, rock, pop and country, Dublin Rose, Clarion Inn, 940 Fall River Ave., Seekonk. (508) 336-9222. 8:30 p.m.-12:30 a.m. The Network, rock, One Pelham East, 270 Thames St., Newport. 847-9460, thepelham.com . 10 p.m.-1 a.m. North Sea Gas, Scottish, Blackstone River Theatre, 549 Broad St., Cumberland. 725-9272, riverfolk.org . 8 p.m. $15. The Ocean Mistics, rock and blues, Ocean Mist, 895 Matunuck Beach Rd., Matunuck. 782-3740, oceanmist.net . 3-6:30 p.m. Oh What a Night, tribute to Frankie Valli and the Four Seasons, Stadium Theatre, 28 Monument Square, Main Street, Woonsocket. 762-4545, stadiumtheatre.com . 8 p.m. $26-$36. Open Mic, Greenwich Hotel, 162 Main St., East Greenwich. 884-4200. 8:30 p.m.-12:30 a.m. No cover. Page 3 of 3 - Raging Grace, Christian rock, Upper Room, 2nd Floor, 1221 Main St., West Warwick. 823-5330, thearticmission.org/upperRoom.html . 7 p.m. Donation. Railroad Earth, roots and Americana, Mohegan Sun, Wolf Den, 1 Mohegan Sun Blvd., Uncasville, Conn. (888) 226-7711, mohegansun.com . 8 p.m. No cover. Rumors, pop, Newport Grand, 150 Admiral Kalbfus Blvd., Newport. 849-5000, newportgrand.com . 9 p.m.-12:30 a.m. No cover. 18+. Claudia Schmidt and Sally Rogers, folk, Vanilla Bean Cafe, 450 Deerfield Rd. (Routes 44, 169 and 97), Pomfret, Conn. (860) 928-1562, vanillabeancafe.com . 8 p.m. $20. 2nd Avenue, rock, Sonoma Bistro and Wine Bar, 7366 Post Rd., North Kingstown. 295-0800, sonomabistrori.com . 8:30-11:30 p.m Johnny T, pop, Luciano’s, 800 Washington St., Wrentham, Mass. (508) 384-3050. 6-11 p.m. Triad featuring Kimber-Lee Jacobsen, pop, Venus de Milo, Empire Grille, 75 Grand Army Highway (Route 6), Swansea. (508) 678-3901, (401) 861-2780, venusdemilo.com . 8:30 p.m.-12:30 a.m. Tribeca, soul, Motown and disco, Ciara Restaurant and Lounge, 678 Killingly St., Johnston. 354-8800. 9 p.m.-1 a.m. Dar Williams, folk, Narrows Center for the Arts, 16 Anawan St., Fall River. (508) 324-1926, narrowscenter.org . 8 p.m. $30 advance; $35 door. Zink Alloy, rock, Woods Tavern, 45 Nooseneck Hill Rd., West Greenwich. 392-1314. 9 p.m. CLASSICAL Piano soloist Thomas Pandolfi, Goff Memorial Hall, 124 Bay State Rd., Rehoboth. (508) 252-3956 carpentermuseum.org . "Russian Romantics Meet the Movies," works inspired by Rachmaninoff and by Rubinstein, Tchaikovsky, Scriabin, Prokofiev and Hamlisch. 7:30 p.m. $18, seniors $16, children/students $8. Part of the Arts in the Village Concert Series.
